  "title": "Restaurant Supervisor",
  "description": "Extramileage Consults Limited -&nbsp;Our client, a quick service restaurant located in Victoria Island, Lagos, is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Restaurant Supervisor
Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos

Requirements


	OND / NC E/ HND / B.Sc. in Hospitality, Business Administration or a related field
	Minimum 2 years experience in a supervisory role in food service or hospitality
	Knowledge of food handling and kitchen operations
	Rotational Shift Duty, 6 days a week.


Salary
N120,000 - N150,000 / month

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;extramileageconsultslimited@gmail.com&nbsp;using &quot;Restaurant Supervisor&quot; as the subject of the email

Note:&nbsp;For more enquiries WhatsApp: 08037910516.",

Restaurant Supervisor Job at Extramileage Consults Limited




        
    

        
        Extramileage Consults Limited - Our client, a quick service restaurant located in Victoria Island, Lagos, is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Restaurant Supervisor
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos

Requirements


	OND / NC E/ HND / B.Sc. in Hospitality, Business Administration or a related field
	Minimum 2 years experience in a supervisory role in food service or hospitality
	Knowledge of food handling and kitchen operations
	Rotational Shift Duty, 6 days a week.


Salary
N120,000 - N150,000 / month
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: extramileageconsultslimited@gmail.com using "Restaurant Supervisor" as the subject of the email

Note: For more enquiries WhatsApp: 08037910516.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "Mecer Consulting Limited is a world class Human Capital Development and Business Growth Re-engineering firm. Our services include, but not limited to: Workforce Development - ISO (QMS, EMS, FSMS, ITMS, MDQMS and all other quality certification) Implementation and Audit.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Prepare financial statements, budgets, and management reports.
	Monitor accounts receivable and payable.
	Manage payroll and employee expense claims.
	Maintain and reconcile bank statements and company accounts.
	Prepare tax computations and ensure compliance with statutory requirements.
	Support internal and external audits.
	Maintain accurate and organized financial documentation.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	3+ years of accounting experience, preferably in a property or construction firm.
	Professional qualification (ICAN, ACCA) is an advantage.


Salary
N200,000 / month

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to:&nbsp;recruitment@mecer.consulting&nbsp;using the Job PPosition as the subject of the mail.",

Accountant Job at Mecer Consulting Limited




        
    

        
        Mecer Consulting Limited is a world class Human Capital Development and Business Growth Re-engineering firm. Our services include, but not limited to: Workforce Development - ISO (QMS, EMS, FSMS, ITMS, MDQMS and all other quality certification) Implementation and Audit.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant
Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Prepare financial statements, budgets, and management reports.
	Monitor accounts receivable and payable.
	Manage payroll and employee expense claims.
	Maintain and reconcile bank statements and company accounts.
	Prepare tax computations and ensure compliance with statutory requirements.
	Support internal and external audits.
	Maintain accurate and organized financial documentation.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	3+ years of accounting experience, preferably in a property or construction firm.
	Professional qualification (ICAN, ACCA) is an advantage.


Salary
N200,000 / month

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: recruitment@mecer.consulting using the Job PPosition as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Compliance Officer",
  "description": "Ericsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment &amp; services to mobile &amp; fixed network operators. Over 1,000 networks in more than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment, &amp; more than 40 percent of the world&#39;s mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Using innovation to empower people, business &amp; society, we are working towards the Networked Society, in which everything that can benefit from a connection will have one. At Ericsson, we apply our innovation to market-based solutions that empower people &amp; society to help shape a more sustainable world.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Compliance Officer

Job ID:&nbsp;774461
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos, Nigeria

About this opportunity


	We are seeking a dedicated Compliance Officer who will play a key role in reinforcing a strong compliance culture, promoting ethical conduct, and ensuring the execution of the E&amp;C Program across our Customer Unit in West and Southern Africa (CU WSA) and the broader EMEA region.
	You will serve as a trusted adviser to management and employees, supporting the full range of compliance activities and acting as a key liaison between business units and the central Compliance Office.


What you will do


	Lead efforts to embed a culture of compliance, transparency and integrity&mdash;serving as a role model and encouraging employees to raise concerns.
	Advise the relevant Customer Unit (CU WSA) on compliance with the Code of Conduct, ethical standards, and relevant regulations.
	Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders (Finance, Legal, Sourcing, People) and external parties (customers, third parties) to ensure compliant business operations.
	Report regularly to local management teams and the broader compliance organisation on the status of compliance programme implementation, including key performance indicators (KPIs).
	Develop and maintain solid understanding of local business activities, processes and applicable anti-corruption/anti-bribery laws and enforcement.
	Identify local compliance risks and obligations; establish and administer appropriate mitigation programmes.
	Partner with Group Compliance colleagues to perform compliance risk assessments, monitoring and reviews.
	Define local/unit compliance priorities and plan the annual compliance activities, prioritising by risk.
	Deliver compliance training and awareness programmes; supplement group-wide training to reflect local requirements.
	Support and oversee Third-Party Management, ensuring due diligence and adherence to policy.
	Provide training on compliance topics to internal colleagues.
	Ensure the effective implementation of compliance policies including Conflicts of Interest, Gifts, Entertainment &amp; Hospitality and Contributions.
	Support remediation activities in cases of misconduct or process gaps.
	Develop practical solutions to compliance issues, with a problem-solving mindset.
	Assist or conduct compliance-related due diligence for mergers &amp; acquisitions and support subsequent integration activities.
	Prepare compliance-related reports as required by the Compliance Office and the Head of Compliance Europe, Middle East &amp; Africa.


The skills you bring


	University Degree (for example in Law, Business, Accounting or another discipline relevant to compliance).
	8&ndash;10 years of experience in compliance, legal or a related field.
	Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills.
	Fluency in English (spoken &amp; written); French language proficiency is a plus.
	Demonstrated leadership, collaboration and conflict-resolution skills.
	Strong business acumen and understanding of operating environments.
	International exposure and cultural awareness.
	Independent, goal-oriented and organised working style, with attention to detail and a systematic approach.
	Comfortable with ambiguity and working in a matrix organisation.
	Ability to manage and execute projects with urgency and across multiple time zones.
	Willingness to travel as required.
	High level of integrity aligned with the company&rsquo;s values of Professionalism, Respect, Perseverance and Integrity.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-22",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-23",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Ericsson Nigeria"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Compliance Officer Job at Ericsson Nigeria




        
    

        
        Ericsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment & services to mobile & fixed network operators. Over 1,000 networks in more than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment, & more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Using innovation to empower people, business & society, we are working towards the Networked Society, in which everything that can benefit from a connection will have one. At Ericsson, we apply our innovation to market-based solutions that empower people & society to help shape a more sustainable world.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Compliance Officer
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job ID: 774461
Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria

About this opportunity


	We are seeking a dedicated Compliance Officer who will play a key role in reinforcing a strong compliance culture, promoting ethical conduct, and ensuring the execution of the E&C Program across our Customer Unit in West and Southern Africa (CU WSA) and the broader EMEA region.
	You will serve as a trusted adviser to management and employees, supporting the full range of compliance activities and acting as a key liaison between business units and the central Compliance Office.


What you will do


	Lead efforts to embed a culture of compliance, transparency and integrity—serving as a role model and encouraging employees to raise concerns.
	Advise the relevant Customer Unit (CU WSA) on compliance with the Code of Conduct, ethical standards, and relevant regulations.
	Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders (Finance, Legal, Sourcing, People) and external parties (customers, third parties) to ensure compliant business operations.
	Report regularly to local management teams and the broader compliance organisation on the status of compliance programme implementation, including key performance indicators (KPIs).
	Develop and maintain solid understanding of local business activities, processes and applicable anti-corruption/anti-bribery laws and enforcement.
	Identify local compliance risks and obligations; establish and administer appropriate mitigation programmes.
	Partner with Group Compliance colleagues to perform compliance risk assessments, monitoring and reviews.
	Define local/unit compliance priorities and plan the annual compliance activities, prioritising by risk.
	Deliver compliance training and awareness programmes; supplement group-wide training to reflect local requirements.
	Support and oversee Third-Party Management, ensuring due diligence and adherence to policy.
	Provide training on compliance topics to internal colleagues.
	Ensure the effective implementation of compliance policies including Conflicts of Interest, Gifts, Entertainment & Hospitality and Contributions.
	Support remediation activities in cases of misconduct or process gaps.
	Develop practical solutions to compliance issues, with a problem-solving mindset.
	Assist or conduct compliance-related due diligence for mergers & acquisitions and support subsequent integration activities.
	Prepare compliance-related reports as required by the Compliance Office and the Head of Compliance Europe, Middle East & Africa.


The skills you bring


	University Degree (for example in Law, Business, Accounting or another discipline relevant to compliance).
	8–10 years of experience in compliance, legal or a related field.
	Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills.
	Fluency in English (spoken & written); French language proficiency is a plus.
	Demonstrated leadership, collaboration and conflict-resolution skills.
	Strong business acumen and understanding of operating environments.
	International exposure and cultural awareness.
	Independent, goal-oriented and organised working style, with attention to detail and a systematic approach.
	Comfortable with ambiguity and working in a matrix organisation.
	Ability to manage and execute projects with urgency and across multiple time zones.
	Willingness to travel as required.
	High level of integrity aligned with the company’s values of Professionalism, Respect, Perseverance and Integrity.
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Human Resources Executive JJob",
  "description": "Uncle Stan&#39;s Foods is a small chops company known for it&#39;s unique finger food taste all over Lagos. Our brand makes us unique.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Positon: Human Resources Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos, Nigeria

Job Summary


	The Human Resource Executive is responsible for supporting all HR functions, ensuring efficient operations of the HR department, and helping to build a productive, compliant, and positive work environment.
	This role focuses on recruitment, employee relations, performance management, HR administration, and ensuring compliance with company policies and labour laws.


Key Responsibilities
Recruitment &amp; Onboarding:


	Manage the end-to-end recruitment process: job posting, screening, interviewing, and onboarding.
	Maintain an updated database of all staff and job applicants.
	Coordinate staff orientation and ensure new hires are properly integrated into the company culture.


Employee Relations:


	Support employee engagement initiatives to foster motivation and retention.
	Address staff grievances promptly and escalate serious issues where necessary.
	Promote effective communication between management and staff.


Performance Management:


	Assist in implementing performance appraisal systems and tracking KPIs.
	Support managers with performance review processes and documentation.


HR Administration:


	Maintain accurate employee records, including attendance, leave, and payroll documentation.
	Prepare HR reports and ensure all HR files are up-to-date and confidential.
	Ensure compliance with company policies and employment laws.


Training &amp; Development:


	Identify training needs and assist in organizing internal and external training sessions.
	Track employee development and training outcomes.


Compliance &amp; Policy Implementation:


	Enforce HR policies, disciplinary actions, and standard operating procedures.
	Keep up to date with labour law regulations and HR best practices.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
	2 - 4 years of experience in a similar HR role.
	Strong understanding of HR principles, Nigerian labour law, and HRIS systems.
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills.
	Proficient in MS Office and HR software (e.g., Zoho People, BambooHR, etc.).


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hrunclestansfoods@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Human Resources Executive JJob at Uncle Stan's Foods




        
    

        
        Uncle Stan's Foods is a small chops company known for it's unique finger food taste all over Lagos. Our brand makes us unique.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Positon: Human Resources Executive

Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Human Resource Executive is responsible for supporting all HR functions, ensuring efficient operations of the HR department, and helping to build a productive, compliant, and positive work environment.
	This role focuses on recruitment, employee relations, performance management, HR administration, and ensuring compliance with company policies and labour laws.


Key Responsibilities
Recruitment & Onboarding:


	Manage the end-to-end recruitment process: job posting, screening, interviewing, and onboarding.
	Maintain an updated database of all staff and job applicants.
	Coordinate staff orientation and ensure new hires are properly integrated into the company culture.


Employee Relations:


	Support employee engagement initiatives to foster motivation and retention.
	Address staff grievances promptly and escalate serious issues where necessary.
	Promote effective communication between management and staff.


Performance Management:


	Assist in implementing performance appraisal systems and tracking KPIs.
	Support managers with performance review processes and documentation.


HR Administration:


	Maintain accurate employee records, including attendance, leave, and payroll documentation.
	Prepare HR reports and ensure all HR files are up-to-date and confidential.
	Ensure compliance with company policies and employment laws.


Training & Development:


	Identify training needs and assist in organizing internal and external training sessions.
	Track employee development and training outcomes.


Compliance & Policy Implementation:


	Enforce HR policies, disciplinary actions, and standard operating procedures.
	Keep up to date with labour law regulations and HR best practices.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
	2 - 4 years of experience in a similar HR role.
	Strong understanding of HR principles, Nigerian labour law, and HRIS systems.
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills.
	Proficient in MS Office and HR software (e.g., Zoho People, BambooHR, etc.).


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrunclestansfoods@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

We assist our customers and clients in setting up laboratories for IVF, diagnostics and research applications, by offering laboratory equipment procurement and supply, after-sales technical backup and scheduled preventive maintenance, specialized and general laboratory consumables, IVF consumables and media.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Procurement Officer will be responsible for sourcing purchasing, and coordinating the timely supply of medical laboratory equipment and consumables both locally and internationally.


Responsibilities


	Source and purchase medical equipment and consumables at competitive prices
	manage supplier relationships and evaluate vendor performance
	coordinate local and international procurement with stock requirements
	Monitor inventory levels and align procurement with stock requirements
	Ensure timely delivery of goods and accurate documentation
	maintain complaince with regulatory and quality standards.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter to:&nbsp;gm@aaamedicalibrationsltd.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Procurement Officer Job at AAA Medi-Calibrations Limited




        
    

        
        AAA Medi-Calibrations Limited is a supplier and distributor of medical Laboratory equipment and consumables. We assist our customers and clients in setting up laboratories for IVF, diagnostics and research applications, by offering laboratory equipment procurement and supply, after-sales technical backup and scheduled preventive maintenance, specialized and general laboratory consumables, IVF consumables and media.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Procurement Officer will be responsible for sourcing purchasing, and coordinating the timely supply of medical laboratory equipment and consumables both locally and internationally.


Responsibilities


	Source and purchase medical equipment and consumables at competitive prices
	manage supplier relationships and evaluate vendor performance
	coordinate local and international procurement with stock requirements
	Monitor inventory levels and align procurement with stock requirements
	Ensure timely delivery of goods and accurate documentation
	maintain complaince with regulatory and quality standards.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter to: gm@aaamedicalibrationsltd.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
